Row.Text: I'm not interested in this.
Ends Event with no effect.
Comet sighted!
A comet has appeared in our night sky. Some believe it to be a miracle, others an ill omen. Your advisors are unsure, and look to you for guidance. What does this mean?
This is a good omen.
{2_InstantYield}.
Our gods favor us.
+1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Our priests will conduct a diviniation to see if this is a positive sign.
50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
Your priests believe that the divination was successful, and your [ICON_PEACE] Faith has increased greatly as a result.
Diviniation successful!
Our observatories are going to learn a lot from this.
+500 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
A meteor has landed!
With a bright flash of light and a huge crash, a meteor has landed near one of our cities. Your officials collected the meteorite and brought it to the capital for study. What should they do with it?
Break it up and send it to the Forge.
50% chance to gain 2 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron.
Your smiths were able to break large lumps of iron out of the meteor, and can forge fine swords and spears from the material.
[ICON_RES_IRON] Iron extracted from meteor!
Divide it up and give it to our priests.
+1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith in all Shrines.
Put it next to my throne.
+2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from Palace.
Donate it to the universities.
+1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science from all Universities.
It belongs in a Museum.
+1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture from all Museums.
Eclipse!
Our people were surprised to witness an eclipse today. What does this mean for our empire?
I'm not sure what this means.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. 25% chance for this effect: {1_YieldCost}
It was a bad omen.{4_Help}
Bad omen!
Quick, make a sacrifice!
Expend {1_YieldCost} in [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Science can explain this!
{2_InstantYield}
Quick, take a picture!
{2_InstantYield}
Heat wave!
Every summer seems hotter than the last, and our lakes and rivers are drying up. Soon, a drought may be upon us. What should we do?
Subsidize the farms.
{1_YieldCost}. You are confident that you can avoid a drought.
Set aside some emergency funds.
{1_YieldCost}. You are hopeful that you can avoid a drought.
Send money to local officials.
{1_YieldCost}. You are unsure that you can avoid a drought.
Grin and bear it. There's nothing we can do.
You are worried about a potential drought.
Ice age!
A sudden drop in average temperatures can only mean one thing: a small ice age! How should we prepare?
People should stay indoors, even if that means less commerce.
-2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Take fuel from our industries and distribute it to the poor and needy.
-2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
Trains and steam power make us immune to the cold.
No negative effect.
Revolution!
To arms! Dissident civilians from across our empire have risen up to contest your rule! What will you do?
Let them eat cake.
2 Barbarians spawn near all owned Cities. 5 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
Use our City-State connections to find common ground.
3 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
We are all brothers and sisters of progress, are we not?
1 Barbarian spawns near every owned City, 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Unrest in all Cities.
Find the leader and bribe him off.
{1_YieldCost}.
War fervor!
Your people clamor for war! Our martial spirit is high, and your military advisor wishes to know how you would like to channel this energy.
Rally the martial spirit of our people.
All valid units gain the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Morale[ENDCOLOR] Promotion. +5 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for {4_Turns}.
Channel the energy into our industries.
+{3_CityYield} in all Cities for {4_Turns}.
The New World Order begins now!
10 turns of 'We Love the King Day' in all Cities. Military Academies produce +5 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science for {4_Turns}.
For the Motherland!
Factories grant Cities +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production for {4_Turns}.
Buy Victory Bonds!
Banks grant Cities +20% [ICON_GOLD] Gold for {4_Turns}.
War weariness!
The toll of war is hard on our people. They seek solace in the face of destruction and defeat, and look to you for guidance. How will you respond?
Give a speech at our Palace.
75% chance that all Cities will produce -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for the next {4_Turns}.
The speech did not move your populace, and they are unhapppier as a result. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities.{4_Help}
Speech unsuccessful!
Have our religious leader pray for the wounded and deceased.
{1_YieldCost}.
Give a radio broadcast to the nation.
25% chance that all Cities will produce -2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
The radio broadcast did not move your populace, and they are unhapppier as a result. -2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in all Cities.{4_Help}
Radio broadcast unsuccessful!
We must win. Begin conscription.
50% chance that all Cities will produce a military unit and bein 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance.
Conscription was successful, but your people are more angry than ever before. All cities experience 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance and produce 1 military unit.
Conscription!
Crowded Markets, Foreign Tongues

Crowds gather in your markets, voices from many different lands ringing out as deals are struck and bargains made. Some are angry about this, and believe that foreigners will destroy our trade. Others, however, encourage the foreign business, hoping to learn from their culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Let the foreigners continue to trade.
Markets in all cities: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, -1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Implement heavy taxes on imported goods.
Markets in all cities: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Icons of Our Past

Monuments represent the most important symbols of your culture. Your people seek to celebrate this by dedicating your Monuments to either their ancestors, or to their gods.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]How do you feel about this? Choose from the following options:
Dedicate Monuments to our ancestors.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
The gods are what is important now.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Neither will suffice. The Monument should generate revenue.
Monuments in all cities: +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Castle Doctrine

People are assembling at the gates of your Castle keeps, demainding safety during war time. Your castles are not large enough to accommodate entire cities, so you must decide: who should be given access to the keep during war?
The nobility, of course.
All Castles produce +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Our finest merchants and craftsmen, according to merit.
All Castles produce +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
The keep is not for citizens!
All Castles produce +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
The clergy, as willed by god.
All Castles produce +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
University Curriculum

Faculty and administration from your state Universities seek to create a unified curriculum for all current and future Universities in your empire. As head of state, they look to you for the final decision. Which would you prefer?
Focus on the hard sciences.
All Universities gain +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Liberal arts education is most important.
All Universities gain +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Divinity education will benefit us the most.
All Universities gain +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith.
Military education seems most prudent.
All Universities gain +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Factory Partnerships

Businessmen approach your government, asking for permission to begin joint-ventures with your Factories. There are five competing partnership bids, and the your government needs guidance. Which would you prefer?
Let's produce luxury textiles.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Cheap textiles sound lucrative.
Factories in all cities: +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Chemicals are a valuable asset
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Pharmaceuticals will benefit our local scientists.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Canned goods will support our growing cities.
Factories in all cities: +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food.
A New Banking System

The complexities of our banking systems are growing, and economic advisors recommend that you establish an empire-wide banking regulation. Guilds currently manage all money in our empire, but some believe this is an outdated management method. Some believe that centralization is the best option, but your advisors are torn on the issue. Of the following options, which do you prefer?
Decentralize it. Our people are more than capable of managing their own money.
All Laborers and Merchants produce +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Guilds should continue to manage our money.
All Banks produce +5% [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Centralize it. Money is too important to leave to private citizens.
All Banks produce +3 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
School Boards Established

School boards were recently established in your cities, and they seek to reform your public school system. They look to you for guidance: would you prefer free tuition for all students, or would you rather privatize the institutions?
Education should be free for everyone.
Public Schools in all cities: +10% [ICON_CULTURE] Culture in the City.
Education should be available to those who can afford it.
Public Schools in all cities: +10% [ICON_GOLD] Gold in the City.
Aging Windmills

Once the pinnacle of industrial design, our nation's Windmills now appear quite outdated. A few industrialists approach you about this topic, hoping to garner imperial support for the modernization of our Windmills. The following proposals are offered to you by these engineers. Which do you prefer?
Undertake a complete rework of our Windmills, starting immediately.
{1_YieldCost}. All Windmills gain a +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production boost.
Coordinate with our Manufactories and integrate them into our modern industrial processes.
{1_YieldCost} and 4 [ICON_RES_IRON] Iron. All Windmills gain a +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production boost.
Retrofit them where we can, otherwise they're fine.
{1_YieldCost}. All Windmills gain a +3 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
World Sporting Event!

The World Sports Organization has chosen your empire to host the WSO International! For the next {4_Turns}, Cities with a Stadium will host games, boosting the [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output of that City!
The WSO chose {3_PlayerName} to host their International Tournament. Their Stadiums will produce lots of [ICON_GOLD] Gold and [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism!{4_Help}
{3_PlayerName} to host World Sports Organization Tournament!
Research Setback
Your researchers regret to inform you that recent research was flawed, and had to be discarded. {1_YieldCost}.
Baby Boom!
Your population is growing exponentially, thanks to a large upswing in births as of late. All Cities gain +1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population and experience 5 turns of 'We Love the King Day.'
Plague Looming
Your advsiors tell you of a distant, virulent disease that is crippling other empires. Hopefully the disease stays far away from our cities...
Debate in Council

Your advisors approach you, each looking harried and frustrated. Apparently they've been arguing back and forth all night trying to find an idea to deliver to you, yet their differences were irreconcilable. They come to you, then, with four proposals, each of which may bring benefit to your empire. Which idea do you like?
Host a gala at the Palace.
Your Foreign Advisor claims that this will provide a 50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
Fund a research grant on 'the nature and origins of efficiency.'
Your Science Advisor claims that this will provide a 50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
Send merchants on a foreign trade expedition.
Your Economic Advisor claims that this will provide a 50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
Host a grand tournament of champions in your Capital.
Your Military Advisor claims that this will provide a 50% chance to gain {2_InstantYield}.
The Gala was a roaring success, much to the delight of your Foreign Advisor. You gain: {4_EventChoiceHelpText}.
Gala Hosted
Your Science Advisor notes that the research grant was successful. You gain: {4_EventChoiceHelpText}.[NEWLINE]Now that's efficiency!
Research Grant
Your Economic Advisor reports that the merchant mission went well. You gain: {4_EventChoiceHelpText}.
Merchant Mission
The tournament was wildly popular, thanks to your Military Advisor's recommendations. You gain: {4_EventChoiceHelpText}.
Grand Tournament
Death of a Merchant

A wealthy merchant in your empire has died, and he left behind an ambiguous will. His two sons, one a sailor and the other a banker, each have legal claim to the inheritance, and have petitioned the state for resolution. What will you decide?
I don't care, however I do intend to tax the inheritance.
+{2_InstantYield}.
The banker's case is more sound, as his investments match those of his father.
Receive a free Caravan in your Capital.
The sailor's ideas would benefit all of our coastal cities.
+{3_CityYieldGlobal} in all coastal Cities.
